IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Ballet West inspires and empowers a broad community locally and globally through exposure, training and education on the art of ballet.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Ballet West inspires and empowers a broad community locally and globally through exposure, training and education on the art of ballet.
IRS990.Desc: a.Ballet West presents five Main Stage productions and one Family Classics Series production every year with numerous events including intermission receptions, artist conversations, donor dinners, community outreach activities, student performances, salon events, and other special events such as the annual Spring Soiree, I CAN DO celebration event, Beer & Ballet, and the End-of-Season Closing Night Party.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: b.Ballet West is home to the Frederick Quinney Lawson Ballet West Academy with four training campuses and approximately 1,000 students aged 3-18 in classical ballet, jazz, and tap. Students from all campuses have an opportunity to perform with main company dancers during a regular production season, providing them the rare opportunity to perform on stage and gain real-world experience.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: c.Ballet West Youth Education and Community Outreach Program serves approximately 100,000 K-12 students and teachers, special needs individuals, and other community members with engaging arts education opportunities and community outreach activities throughout the state of Utah annually, digital and/or in-person, and free-of-charge. The programs celebrate the artistry and athleticism of ballet, allowing Utahans of all ages and from all backgrounds the opportunity to experience the art form through various touchpoints.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Ballet has evaluated tax positions and believes it does not have and has not recorded a liability for any uncertain tax positions.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Part XII, Line 2d: Other expenses and losses per audited F/S
